snippet: The announcement ratcheted up pressure on President Dilma Rousseff, who is facing calls for her ouster over a sweeping graft scheme at the national oil company.
abstract: Eduardo Cunha, speaker of Brazil's lower house of Congress, breaks from ruling Workers Party in move that could intensify efforts to impeach Pres Dilma Rousseff.
lead_paragraph: The announcement ratcheted up pressure on President Dilma Rousseff, who is facing calls for her ouster over a sweeping graft scheme at the national oil company.

headline.main: Turmoil Deepens in Brazil as House Speaker Splits From Dilma Rousseff’s Coalition
headline.print_headline: Speaker Splits From Coalition Amid Turmoil in Brazil
